event: Earliest human settlement in present-day Ireland
Neolithic farmers build megalithic monuments such as Newgrange
Celtic culture and language spread across the island
Early Christian monasteries flourish across Ireland
Viking raids begin along the Irish coast
Vikings establish Dublin as a trading settlement
Battle of Clontarf weakens Viking power in Ireland
Norman invasion begins English involvement in Ireland
English authority retreats outside the Pale around Dublin
England declares Ireland a kingdom under the English crown
Flight of the Earls marks collapse of Gaelic aristocracy
Act of Union incorporates Ireland into the United Kingdom
Great Famine causes mass death and emigration
Easter Rising ignites modern independence movement
Irish Free State gains independence from Britain
Ireland becomes a fully independent republic
Good Friday Agreement helps end decades of conflict in Northern Ireland
